Event.name: Run_risk
Event.definition: A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself. An Asset which is in danger of loss may stand in for the Bad_outcome. There is no implication that the Protagonist intentionally exposes themself to the risky situation. The Protagonist may be attempting to achieve some Purpose, which involves being in a dangerous situation. The Severity of risk involved may also be expressed. There was a risk of fire. Original thinkers incur greater risks to their careers than their pedestrian colleagues. NOTE: This Frame is currently in the process of being changed so that some instances of at risk.n will be moved to the Being_at_risk frame, and some will be moved to the Risky_situation frame. In the Being_at_risk frame, risk is almost always supported with at, and its external argument is the Asset. Risky_situation uses of risk include the following: Smoking poses a risk to your health. Smoking is a health risk. The most imminent risk is to our infrastructure. but (possibly ; still under discussion) not: The most imminent RISK is that our infrastructure may not be able to handle the load. In the Risky_situation frame, the external argument is the Situation, and the Bad_outcome in not expressible. The verb risk.v will remain in the Run_risk frame, in the sense of he risked his life for his country. The construction run risk also will remain in the Run_risk frame.

Arg.name: Protagonist
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The place where there is risk. <ex>There is always some <t>danger</t> to rich men <fex name="Place">in a bar like this</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Severity
Arg.definition: <def-root>The probability of something bad happening to the <fen>Protagonist</fen>. <ex>If he is uncertain of right and wrong, he is in <fex name="Sev">dire</fex> <t>peril</t> of losing his immortal soul.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time when the risk pertains. <ex><fex name="Time">Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the <t>risk</t> of letting racism continue forever.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Bad_outcome
Arg.definition: <def-root>A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid. <ex>There was no <t>risk</t> <fex name="Bad">of his returning</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Asset
Arg.definition: <def-root>Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged. <ex>The <t>risk</t> <fex name="Asset">to his reputation</fex> was significant.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Action
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk. <ex><fex name="Action">Implementing this program</fex> <supp>runs</supp> the <t>risk</t> of offending our core constituents.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Frequency</fen> with which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> runs risks.
<ex>Some people have no problem with <t>risking</t> their hides <fex name="fre">every day</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The desired action or goal that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> hopes to bring about.
<ex>They all <t>risked</t> being caught <fex name="Pur">in order to come to the United States</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Explanation</fen> for why the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has put the <fen>Asset</fen> is in a dangerous situation.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> risks an <fen>Asset</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> indicates the state of affairs under which the risky situation holds.
<ex>Putting forward new ideas <t>risks</t> sparking controversy <fex name="cir">if you don't frame your argument properly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> intends for his/her actions to benefit <fen>Beneficiary</fen> in some way.
<ex>They would <t>risk</t> all <fex name="ben">for their closest friends</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: risk.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a situation which puts a person in danger

lexUnit.name: endangered.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: at risk, especially of extinction.

lexUnit.name: peril.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a situation of serious and immediate danger.

lexUnit.name: risk.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of a situation or action) inviting risk or danger.

lexUnit.name: wager.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: put in danger, as if gambling.
